fields.description:
As a user, I expect the Alarm Detail form to only allow valid values to be saved to my cloud.

Form validation, disable Save Changes button until all fields are validated.

comments.body: [~ashamblin]: I can't get any validation error messages to display in the create alarm dialog (tested on Instance Monitoring page).  I tried emptying the alarm name, entering a duplicate alarm name, and entering 'aa' as the percentage for a CPUUtilization alarm.  Although the submit button was disabled, there are no validation error notices displayed.  What am I missing?
https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1886

Not seeing any validation error when I enter a negative number in several fields that should not allow them. Validation also didn't seem to work on create alarm.

Also, unit says "None"? Is that really the unit? If there's no unit for a metric, we shouldn't have anything displaying there, it should just be blank. Can you fix that too while you are in there, please?
David, please review for validation.
Please assign to [~kgill] for style updates after code review.
Looks good, assuming the && noted in the PR don't bother i18n update functions.

Validation for Create Alarm dialog looks good, and I tweaked/merged PR 1886 as it was blocking remaining work in GUI-2504.  Punting back to [~ashamblin] to implement form validation handling on Alarm Detail page as noted in the ticket title.

please mark the name field on create alarm as required when you are fixing this. 

Also, please be sure it comes back to me for UX review before moving to QA, thanks!

Also, validation on here is still weird, please fix:
*  create alarm and add action buttons are active when not all required fields have data
* I tab out of name field and get no validation error that it is required

Thanks!

issues noted in previous comment seem specific to create alarm when launched from metric landing page, however I did notice that the add action button, while disabled from instance detail page, is not picking up correct styling...should be the same lighter gray as the big submit button, and no visible changes on mouseover. 

Thanks!
Styling and validation fixes will be addressed as part of GUI-2466, as those issues are limited to the create alarm dialog on the metrics landing page.

https://github.com/eucalyptus/eucaconsole/pull/1892

New PR, please review alarm detail page.

Hi [~ashamblin], several issues:
* Save changes button is enabled even though I haven't changed anything. *[DONE]*
* I was able to deselect al dimensions and tab out of that field without getting a validation error that dimension is required. It also didn't flag when i saved the page. *[DONE]*
* add action button enables when no policies have been selected
* cancel button on hover should be $hpe-green please. It's blue ATM. [~kgill] fixed this in GUI-2466 branch already. *[DONE]*
* Disabled Add Action button is wrong shade of gray. Should match disabled submit button style. *[DONE]*
* i partially filled out the alarm action thing, without adding, and then did save changes. It should flag that like when you populate a tag without saving the tag (see instance details) and warn you but it doesn't

[~jloza], I've marked the validation work that is done above.  Would like to move Action Editor issues into a bug for the bug cycle if that's cool.  We need this code in pronto, and I think it's going to take some effort to smooth out action editor details.
[~ashamblin], go ahead and put the ticket into review and open a linked ticket for the remaining action editor issues. Gotta do whatcha gotta do when we are this close to the end!
Alarm Action Editor issues addressed in GUI-2530.

Hi [~ashamblin], I noticed the dimension is not longer included by default in the dimension chosen, it's empty when I first open the details page. That used to work, not sure what's up there. That chosen also no longer gives me any options to select. Something's broken.
[~jloza] Can you provide an example?  I'm seeing it working just fine.
Screenshots attached. test acct 00/admin, osx/chrome

UX review passed. Validation error messages are slightly different but that's OK for now, we just need to get done, and it's unlikely someone will hit two on the same page and notice. 

Ready for code review.
PR 1892 merged
